prescriptions.name: Lisinopril
prescriptions.instructions: Take 3 tablets by mouth once daily in the morning with food for 3 days, then take 2 tablets daily.
prescriptions.details: Lisinopril is an oral medication primarily used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) and heart failure.
prescriptions.side_effect: Lisinopril can cause side effects like dizziness, headache, fatigue, nausea, and a persistent dry cough.
prescriptions.tab_short_desc: Lisinopril is an ACE inhibitor that lowers blood pressure and treats heart failure by relaxing blood vessels

prescriptions.name: Lisinopril
prescriptions.instructions: Take 3 tablets by mouth once daily in the morning with food for 3 days, then take 2 tablets daily.
prescriptions.details: Lisinopril is an oral medication primarily used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) and heart failure. It belongs to a class of drugs known as ACE inhibitors (Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme inhibitors). By relaxing blood vessels, lisinopril helps reduce blood pressure and makes it easier for the heart to pump blood.
prescriptions.side_effect: Lisinopril can cause side effects like dizziness, headache, fatigue, nausea, and a persistent dry cough. In rare cases, it may lead to serious issues such as angioedema (swelling of the face, lips, or throat), high potassium levels (causing irregular heartbeat or muscle weakness), and kidney problems, signaled by reduced urine output or swelling. Severe dizziness or fainting can also occur if blood pressure drops too low. Allergic reactions, including rashes and itching, are also possible. Patients should consult their doctor if they experience any severe or unusual symptoms.
prescriptions.tab_short_desc: Lisinopril is an ACE inhibitor that lowers blood pressure and treats heart failure by relaxing blood vessels
